author: sebmdp
post_text: October 27, 2014 at 6:12â€¯PM#1Dear all,I'm looking for the right syntax to filter the result of the ifoutput function by the keyword PresetType.Seems that those syntaxes don't work :CodeifOutput PresetType x (where x is the choosen PresetType)ifOutput PresetType x.x.x (for the choosen attribute of feature x of preset type x)ifOutput At PresetType xifOutput On PresetType xwhileCodeIfOutput Preset 4.5for color preset nb 5 worksPlease note that I really want to filter the result by the PresetType and not by recorded Preset. For example I want to be able to find fixtures that have a blade engaged or a gobo parameter >0Thanks for your help.Regards.S.D.
title: IfOutput filtered by PresetType
